intro: Triumfetta neglecta, commonly known as the small-leaved triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Triumfetta neglecta is also used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
